lead_paragraph: Northern Alliance soldiers, backed by American and British Special Operations forces, said today that they had crushed a revolt by Taliban prisoners inside a 19th-century fortress, and described a deadly final battle in which they drove the rebels from their last stronghold by pouring oil into a basement, setting it alight and then opening fire with their lone Soviet T-55 tank. Although Gen. Tommy Franks, the American commander of the war in Afghanistan, told reporters in Tampa, Fla., that some 30 to 40 rebels were still holding out inside the fortress, the Northern Alliance declared the Taliban revolt crushed 50 hours after it erupted.
abstract: Northern Alliance soldiers, backed by American and British Special Operations forces, report crushing revolt by Taliban prisoners at fortress near Mazar-i-Sharif, Afghanistan; describe driving rebels from last stronghold by setting blaze and then opening fire with tank; say most of some 400 prisoners were killed by American airstrikes; has lost about 50 men, with some 100 wounded, in two days of fighting; photo (M)
